objtitle.title: *The Spiritual Form of Pitt Guiding Behemoth*

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with some pen and ink outlining and shell gold or gold leaf

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake or his wife Catherine by Samuel Palmer; by inheritance in 1881 to his son, Alfred Herbert Palmer; offered from A. H. Palmer's collection, Christie's, 20 March 1882, lot 108 (bought-in at £100); sold in 1882 to the National Gallery, London; transferred in 1931 to the Tate Gallery, now Tate Collection.

desc.objtitle:
The Spiritual Form of Pitt Guiding Leviathan,
Object 1 (Butlin 651)

objnote.p: Blake included this tempera painting in his 1809 exhibition, number II in the accompanying *Descriptive Catalogue*, and in the 1812 exhibition of the Associated Painters in Water Colors, number 279 in the accompanying *Catalogue of the Fifth Annual Exhibition by the Associated Painters in Water Colors*.
